Reviews.Title: “Not a Napa resort but a good value”
Reviews.Author: Virginia_23707
Reviews.Content: Rooms were priced fairly. These are more like drive up motels. Staff is kind and helpful. Ammenities were good if not dated. DISH tv service in each room. 5 minutes from downtown Napa. Not as clean ad a resort but a good value. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean your own room when you check in”
Reviews.Author: stratosphere12
Reviews.Content: I had to clean up a messy, dripping full of water refrigerator that was not plugged in. The microwave was so flithy I had to take to turntable to the desk and ask them to clean off the grease on it. There is no extra toilet paper or blankets or pillows, there is no lightbulb in the lamp an the bed is hard as a rock. Find another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Lovina T
Reviews.Content: I went hoping for a clean room/sheets, good WIFI, good heat, and a enjoyable shower. This meet all my needs. The staff was nice. Got a good online price. For the budget level this exceeded expectations. The rooms do look like the photo, nicer than the outside of the buildings. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable and quiet stay on the Silverado Trail”
Reviews.Author: michjoju
Reviews.Content: We visited Napa on our way home from the Sacramento area. We were told about this place by a salesman at a car dealership. It was a great stay. We had a room with a small refrig. and microwave, a tiled walk in shower. It was out of the way on the Silverado Trail. It was very quiet, pleasant and very clean and a nice pick it up continental breakfast which we took back to our room. A little carport was just to the side of our room so that was nice. It was a cold evening and the small room heated up nicely with a wall furnace. It was decorated nice with nice carpet too. It felt like being at a nice little villa in Italy from the outside of the area. There is also a couple of tables and chairs outside the office in which you can eat your breakfast if the weather is warmer during your visit. We would go there again. We were given a winter rate which was greatly appreciated and we were received hospitably.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Book a Room With This Hotel - ever!”
Reviews.Author: Kdd33235
Reviews.Content: I held two reservations for this property - one in July 2011 which I cancelled on their website (prior to them posting on their website that cancellations online were not allowed) and another in November. I cancelled July in accordance with the cancellation policy at that time but was unable to print it out because their dialog box was so small it wouldn't print. They put the charge for first night through on my credit card even though the reservation was cancelled and the manager kept insisting he had spoken with me. Clearly, he did not. I gave him the date I had cancelled the reservation and he refused to search their emails for my correspondence. At the time all of this was going on, I told him to make certain he had cancelled the November 2011 as well. He assured me they did. Then, I received a call from the manager in November wanting to know why I had not appeared for my reservation. I informed him again that it was because I had cancelled it, twice. I told the manager I intended to report him and this property to the Better Business Bureau. I will never make another reservation at this property again. I requested the owner's name and/or hotel management company and he refused to give it to me.

Reviews.Title: “So rude”
Reviews.Author: P_S98742934723
Reviews.Content: I called up to make a reservation. On their website it says that they are pet friendly. When I told them we had a dog, he said "no" and hung up on me. I can't believe he was so rude. We go up to Napa a lot and clearly will never stay here if that's how they treat their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book your Napa Vacation here!”
Reviews.Author: bdaniel_11
Reviews.Content: This place is terrible, when we checked in we were shocked by how disgusting the room was. It was so bad, that we had to sit in the car to decide what we wanted to do. The hotel had a 72 hour cancelation policy, so we could not cancel. So we decided to pay for the room and find another hotel. This is after telling the people at the front desk that we were not happy, them moving us to the "larger King Suite" where there was a gigantic stain on the comforter. Again, we could not even stand to stay in the room to decide what we wanted to do. I could go on and on listing and describing, but I don't really feel like re-living. Trust me...it was bad!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of management charging for no shows on dates you didn't reserve!”
Reviews.Author: Alison S
Reviews.Content: I had made an reservation for a date far in advance to stay 2 nights which was verbally confirmed, but I never received a written or email confirmation only to discover later that I was charged for a no show on a date that I had not reserved. I then called the Inn to inquire and the man was unpleasant and screaming at me on the phone. I requested to have my credit card look into the matter and found I had no recourse and was stuck with the $100 bill. Now I fully support hotels charging for no shows but what if a reservation was made in good faith but not correctly recorded by the hotel? I can only advise that you request written proof of your reservations here and double check the dates.

Reviews.Title: “Bad smell, hard bed only good if you are staying for one night and need a cheap room and nothing else.”
Reviews.Author: enp0907
Reviews.Content: We arrived to our room and it was hot and smelled of old animal urine. I think it used to be a pet friendly hotel. Once we turned on the A/C and opened the windows it helped a little but the smell was still noticeable. The bathroom was nice but the bed was very hard and difficult to sleep on. The front desk was not very helpful when asked questions about tours, transportation and other things to do in Napa. The continental breakfast was limited but at least the coffee was good. This place would be good if you have a car and need a free space to park, however if you don't have your own form of transport it is not very convenient or close to downtown. If you are looking for a cheap deal and a bed then this place is for you, but if you require a little more service, cleanliness, convenience and comfort then it would better to go for a place that costs a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, private, and quiet! A bargain.”
Reviews.Author: casualtraveler318
Reviews.Content: Friendly personnel. Most rooms do not share a common wall with another room, thus a very private feeling. Also, every room faces a large, open area. This made the room much quieter than most hotels. A nice plus is the covered area for parking your vehicle. The room was very clean, and surprisingly welcoming. Downtown Napa is only a few minutes away. The only negative is the breakfast. It's just dry, cold cereal and coffee. We went out to eat.

Reviews.Title: “good compromise”
Reviews.Author: paleITA
Reviews.Content: I did like price if compared to other motels around town, we were also upgraded from queen size to king and the room was quite clean even if the AC was stincking and very noisy. I did not even try to have breakfast since I knew there was nothing fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Bad smell, poor breakfast but good shower and parking”
Reviews.Author: savvytraveller93
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed here as part of a tour of northern California and well, how can I say, would not really recommend the Discovery Inn. When I arrived the room had been shut up all day in the heat with no windows open and so had an unbearable musty hot unpleasant smell. This called for all windows and the door to be left open, however it never really cleared. On the upside the room had a fridge, wifi and I assume a recently installed shower which was nice. After a fresh shower, I had a slightly more positive outlook on the place however not much of an improvement. I understand its a budget place but an air-freshener really wouldn't go a miss and would make a great deal of difference. Also, the breakfast does not have a great deal of variety. The have bagels, cornflakes and some sort of sugar coated hoops by way of cereal and some individually wrapped pastries as well as bananas and orange juice. Also the owner is a little strange/ creepy and never really gives you straight answers to your questions which was odd and didn't help with the already rising sense of uneasiness. You cannot fault its location, Napa seems like a lovely town, but somehow I don't think we'll be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Actually Not Pet Friendly, Refused Refund”
Reviews.Author: Tracilr
Reviews.Content: I found this low cost motel on hotels.com, which states it as a pet friendly hotel and then booked directly on Napa Discovery Inn's website. When I arrived to check in on June 16th and saw a small sign stating that no pets were allowed, the front desk manager refused to give me a refund and refused to provide an owner or a manager's name or contact information. In fact, he insisted that I let my 2 small dogs sleep outside. In the neighborhood this motel is in, I was nervous to keep the car outside, let alone 2 small house pets. I had to book another hotel that evening that was actually pet friendly and double-checked the websites to make sure I wasn't mistaken about the policies the manager insisted was present on their site and currently there is still nothing stating that pets are not allowed. I called again and spoke with another supposed manager and she stated that their pet policy is posted on their site, even though she couldn't tell me where and again would not provide an owner contact and refused a refund. I have booked several travel services online over the years and have never encountered anything like this before and have no idea what to do to get my money back.

Reviews.Title: “Coming back next year”
Reviews.Author: gstar1887
Reviews.Content: Overall, i would have to say this is a great find in the area. Beyond the old adobe style building lies a comfortable bed, hot shower, and people at the desk that help with local suggestions. I would say the inn is fair for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BenC37
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my wife and we were very impressed. We loved how cute the rooms were with every room having their own garage. Beds were comfy, the service was very friendly and I would definitely go back here.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely come back here again!!”
Reviews.Author: mp2266
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Discovery Inn a few weeks ago and had a good experience. Me and my husband were doing a little weekend getaway to the wine valley and wanted to get the best for our buck! Initially I was hesitant about checking in to this little place because it doesn’t look up to date from the outside. We checked in and were warmly greeted by the front desk clerk (I believe his name was Peter). We were checked in in a jiffy and had noticed a wine tour that was service. Peter kindly made the reservation on the spot and gave us an abundance of other information such as go to wineries, restaurants, and a wine tasting pass for one of the local wineries. As far as the room went, we had a nice king size room. It was decently spacious a little small to my liking but definitely good for what I paid for. It seemed like they had installed brand new carpet so the smell of the new carpet over took the room. I think new carpet smell is better than old musty carpet. Overall this was a good place. Friendly management and nice rooms. The wine tour was well worth the $99 a person! Definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “very nice and funny place to stay, thank you”
Reviews.Author: hotzli
Reviews.Content: Our longer term stay of 3 Weeks was a very pleasant and economic one in that place, the Owner and his friendly family always had an open ear when i asked for something. Thank you for that very nice time Peter and Claudia

Reviews.Title: “Price, value & good winery help”
Reviews.Author: royalstarla
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with two mates. The location was fantastic, right near the spot of town without the price. The rooms were reasonable sized and clean. Good winery suggestions and passes from the young chap in the office. I recommended if you and your mates are looking for a inexpensive place without the laps of luxury. Major bummer for breakfast, no choices.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much...”
Reviews.Author: andyrite
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and the price is right, and if those are your main concerns in staying there, then go for it. Stop on your way to going someplace else. The room is spartan - I had to ask for an extra towel for my hair as only two are provided. There was exactly one partial roll of toilet paper, it was on the holder, and no kleenex. Had to use toilet paper to blow our noses, and if we'd run out of toilet paper, I guess we'd have been using one of the wine brochures we'd brought with us. But the most uncomfortable part is that the room was cold! It was 57 degrees when we woke up in the morning and we were cold all night. There's a heater in the room, but no controls. The bed has a thin blanket and a thin bedspread. The water in the sink and the shower has to be run for at least a minute and more like two minutes, before hot water comes out. The water pressure in the shower is very light. I didn't see any evidence of a breakfast, don't know where some of the other reviewers found that, but the office/lobby is about 6 square feet, so don't expect much. All in all, we won't be back, even if the price was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay overnight”
Reviews.Author: prestonaug
Reviews.Content: I found it to be a good and clean place to stay overnight for an even better price. Booked the room online and I was happy to find out there was free wifi too. Overall not bad. Could improve on breakfast but not that important.

Reviews.Title: “The Urine Inn”
Reviews.Author: clasiephd1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 15 for $109 per night. The windows were open when we walked into the room but it still smelled like human urine on the carpet. The Indian/Pakistani manager sadly denied the foul smell in the room. The smell of urine comes from the carpeting between the beds--no doubt some wine-o could not make it to the bathroom and just pised on the carpet. The management is too cheap to replace the carpeting. When we checked out early the next day--the guy charged me for an extra night--BEWARE--CHEAPO IS NOT ALWAYS A GOOD DEAL!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Motel”
Reviews.Author: BhulaCH
Reviews.Content: I like this motel because fo the friendly staff they have. I will stay here again. this motel is a hidden gem with incredible staff, and the room was comfortable elegant, clean, and Napa style. Abiance Nice Serene Appealing Healthy Pretty Optimistic Airy Kool I will stay here again and again

Reviews.Title: “Warm and personal service!”
Reviews.Author: genegreenbean
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on our honeymoon. We arrived late but the owner still greeted us warmly and mentioned that he was expecting us. We mentioned about some difficulties in booking the hot air balloon ride, and he offered to help us call the company using his phone. The next day unfortunately, the weather was bad and we couldn't proceed. The owner got to know about this as he saw us coming back, and recommended some tours, also offering to help us call the tour company. But never pushy! We required some help in printing tickets for a theme park which we were going to later on in our trip and approached him again. Though it was already night time, he didn't hesitate to help us and even invited us to his house so that we could use his computer to print the tickets. Very helpful and personal service! Only bad thing about the hotel was the bath tub.. It didn't look clean enough for us to want to soak in it.

Reviews.Title: “great value and location”
Reviews.Author: jamaes22
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel. We wanted to save money on the hotel so that we could spend more on food and wineries - so it worked out perfectly for us! It's definitely a no frills place, but you really can't beat the price, especially for the location, right at the bottom of Silverado Trail - it was perfect. After reading some of the reviews here we were pretty nervous but everything turned out fine. There was no smell (and I am very sensitive to smells). The room was a good size, with a little hall/foyer when you walk in and another little area with a desk near the bed. Everything was very clean, and the owner was very nice. There were plenty of breakfast choices.... cereal, bagels, bread, pastries, orange juice, fruit, oatmeal and coffee. Also, we actually got free reserve tasting at Frank Family Vineyards because we were staying here (a $50 value!).

Reviews.Title: “Just what you'd expect”
Reviews.Author: WhereToNextt
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a [relatively] cheap hotel in Napa, then this is the place to go. It's a budget hotel so keep that in mind. It's clean enough and definitely a no-frills place but it's the cheapest place we could find in the area. Also, it's only about 15 minutes from some of the wineries. The gentleman that owns it was very accommodating whenever we needed more pillows, blankets, etc. The continental breakfast includes oatmeal, cereal, bagels, etc. Overall, it was just what we were looking for. There was a TV in the room too.

Reviews.Title: “OK except for smell!”
Reviews.Author: nadams59
Reviews.Content: We didn't realize this was such a busy time for Napa when we made reservations a month ago, and finally settled on DIscovery after finding everything else full. I figured as long as it was clean I wouldn't complain. As many have mentioned, there was a terrible smell (urine). The owner stated he had just cleaned the carpet 10 days ago, which might have actually brought out the smell if there was old dog urine. (I didn't realize pets were allowed until reading other reviews). The owner sprayed room deoderizor at 5pm, but by bedtime it was back. The next day I bought a $1 can of spray at a store, and after several applications I was able to go to sleep. The best part of the hotel was feeling like we were able to buy a few more bottles of wine for the money we saved on lodging.

Reviews.Title: “An Objective review”
Reviews.Author: atsffan
Reviews.Content: OK - I've seen more than a few people denigrate this place for various cheesy reasons - but, let me try and be objective about this. Firstly, it's an inexpensive place. You get a clean room and bathroom, quiet location (we had room #7 in the back - and got to see the deer!), a firm bed, and not much else. We stayed three nights and had zero complaints. OK, yes, when we walked in, there was a strong cleaning agent odor. After leaving the door open for 15 minutes to get a nice breeze through the room and the smell was much reduced. And my wife is highly (HIGHLY) sensitive to strong odors. If it had been as bad as some state, I guarantee you, I'd have to start looking for a new place. I don't need wifi, (I'm on VACATION!), so I didn't get to access it. The manager was very pleasant, even getting the room ready for us just after noon when we arrived. We wanted an inexpensive, decent quality room in Napa and got exactly that. I wanted to spend my money on wine and food, not an overpriced "spa" experience. The Discovery Inn delivered exactly what was promised. I highly recommend this place, but it's just a great hotel that gives you a perfect base of operations for Napa and Sonoma Valleys - and Bodega Bay too along the coast - less than an hour away and a cool getaway from the Highway 29 crowds. Also - stay off 29! Take Silverado Trail, much less traveled and a great selection of wineries heading north to St. Helena. And Mumm (champagne) too.

Reviews.Title: “Way over priced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: TravellingJava
Reviews.Content: The room we got smelled immediately upon entering. The smell was an excessive carpet freshener type of smell. We accepted since we had a dog along and figured it was "the" dog room. The carpet was also quite dirty. The price was extensive for a room in the valley and they charged a pet fee with no benefits. The bathroom was very dated. If you are over five feet tall you'll need to bend to see your face in the mirror. The shower had good hot water and pressure. The toilet was an old style round type. The owner/operator wasn't to friendly but OK. The continental breakfast consisted of two canisters of dry cereal and a pre-packaged sweet roll. We didn't try it or coffee and instead went to Starbucks that was down the road . There wasn't a pet area and no dog bags provided for pickup. The road noise from Silverado trail wasn't too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, but cheap and a good base for exploring the valley”
Reviews.Author: cmmiller
Reviews.Content: This is a motel, nothing fancy but the rooms are good sized. The bathrooms are full sized and include hairdryers and soaps. The room itself was plenty of space and had a mini fridge and microwave as well as TV with free cable. It's basic accommodation, but at a fair price. The inn is right on Silverado Trail, so there is definitely noise from the road at all hours - make sure to ask for a room set back from the street or else you'll be hearing the cars and trucks all night long. Breakfast is super basic and includes hot coffee, bagels and toast, only catch is the only place to eat is either outside or in your room. If you're going to Napa on a budget, then the Discovery Inn isn't a bad bet.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and great location”
Reviews.Author: tiktours
Reviews.Content: I was looking frantically for an affordable yet clean hotel in Napa. Fortunately for me, this hotel had one room left for the weekend. When I got there I was happy to see that the room smelled clean. Our room had a car port so parking was great. The location of this hotel is so close to downtown Napa. We were 1 mile away from the Wine Train and that is why I needed a hotel that was close. The staff was super friendly and I would definitely recommend this place especially if you only need a place to sleep and will be spending the rest of your time wine tasting etc.

Reviews.Title: “It's a budget hotel in an expensive area-- whaddya expect?”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_in_So_Cal
Reviews.Content: Not sure how to categorize this one. It's definitely plain-wrap, to an extreme. On the other hand, we have paid much more and received a room with mildewed tile and unusable pillows. The staff person we met was very eager to please. (But we had to call him repeatedly to find out how to access the internet or get the television to work.) The room was fairly clean (my husband found more to object to than I did) and newly-tiled and painted. We slept well and our room, halfway back, was very quiet. The air conditioner was efficient if a bit moldy-smelling when first turned on. There are no screens on the windows, so if you opt for leaving the bathroom window open for a bit of air, you may get bugs, too. It is a very old motor court, Breakfast is minimal and left in a very small nook for general use. If you were in Napa to be wined, dined, and pampered, this place would definitely feel out-of-sync. If you, like us, were in Napa for a few quick errands and an overnight stop to break up an 800-mile trip from North to South, with no time to use a pool or other amenities (non-existent here) it worked out OK

Reviews.Title: “bad smell”
Reviews.Author: tck79
Reviews.Content: I didn't have high expectations at all, and perhaps the small rooms are better. However, the large room for our family of 5, smelled very strongly of lemon air freshener, the next morning it was obviously masking a strong smell of urine. I knew they would charge $10 per person extra when occupied by more than two, but I didn't expect another $25 for the rollaway. I'm used to budget hotels, but this one is far too pricey for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel may be inexpensive....for good reason. Do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: ReadheadM
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled. This "inn" is a converted motor lodge. When I first walked into my room I immediately returned to the office and asked for another room since my room smelled so musty. Unfortunately the next room they gave me smelled equally horrible. The "inn" is very old construction and the furishings inside the rooms are ancient. I shutter to think how old the mattress was. The ceiling in my bathroom was so low that only people 5'5" and under could manuever comfortably. Their continental breakfast in the morning is coffee and packaged muffins in the office. There is no dining room. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “2 Rooms, 3 nights, No complaints”
Reviews.Author: larry172
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms here for a few nights and we had no complaints. Everytime we needed a taxi Peter was very helpful by calling them for us and sending them directly to our rooms for pickup. And everytime I asked for suggestions on food and places to go, he always helped. One of the outdoor tables by the office was pretty dusty so I had to grab some napkins and wipe it down but other than that, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: jeffkramer
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place to stay, but the staff kept it from being a pleasant experience for me. The person at the front desk told me that if we slept in both of the beds in our room they would charge us more 4-5 times. I get it, I think it's dumb, but sure, whatever. No welcome, not friendly, just kind of confrontational. I'm sure there are places in Napa that would be nicer and with a more friendly vibe. The room itself was large, clean, the beds were passable, we just didn't feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: SashaFleet
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute and were delighted. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the proprietor Andy was exceptionally helpful and friendly. Though we didn't have any of the food we noticed some nice breakfast foods available and we did fill our bottles with the fresh drinking water. Next time we would ask for one of the rooms near the back of the property so there would be very little road noise and we could see the field behind the place where others have seen deer roaming. Strongly recommended for this price point. Also, loved the car parked right outside the room door. It was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, nice cabin(s)”
Reviews.Author: jano10
Reviews.Content: I had one quiet, nice night. Clean good room. Have all one need. Good situated. Price ok with cupon during week days. Regards from Jan Olaf R

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Nice Little Place”
Reviews.Author: joe_travelerSoCal
Reviews.Content: Once cottages for migrant farm workers, this tiny place has small unattached rooms which are top notch. The rooms and grounds are spotless. We found this place in either the room saver or travel coupon guide which are free coupon magazines found at places like Denny's or 7-11. Not sure where we found the coupon books but they sure saved us lots of money on our 7 day trip of Northern CA and Reno. This property has been in the family name for the past 20 years according to the girl at the desk. She was quite helpful and friendly. Included the basic free continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return!”
Reviews.Author: TinaDizzle
Reviews.Content: You can find much better places to go! This was a last minute trip for me and my husband and I would never recommend this place to any of my friends. The room smelled very bad and despite the "renovations" they may have made it did not look like any of the pictures of the room from the advertisement. My husband is 6'1" and he couldn't fit in the shower b/c of the ceiling. The room was not spacious either, definitely not worth my money to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Cute & Great Rate”
Reviews.Author: szila
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 nite and being on a budget the Napa Discovery Inn met our needs. The room was clean and simple, just what we needed to complete our visit in Napa. They did provide a continental breakfast, but I didnt like their coffee. We even had our own private carport for parking. I have already recommended it to others as a place to stay for a less fancy/budget get away and hope to return sometime. The owners were very nice and accomadating.

Reviews.Title: “Judged based on the sleep I had”
Reviews.Author: minimalistgoe1977
Reviews.Content: I typically don’t judge hotels by the way they look. I’ve stayed at nicer looking places but had an awful sleep and places that didn’t look luxurious and had a great sleep. In the case of this place, it would be the later, non luxurious place but a great night’s sleep. I don’t know if it was the wine we had during the day or the beds but I had one of the best nights sleep at a hotel I’ve had in a long time at this place. The other really cool thing I liked was being able to park my car right next to my room door under a covered spot…very unique! Overall, not bad at all and definitely worth the price. If you want to try something different, check this place out!

Reviews.Title: “For what we paid, we can't really complain. Remember, just the basics...”
Reviews.Author: njhotness44
Reviews.Content: Someone else described this place as just the basics, and that's about all you're going to get at the Discovery. There's nothing really to "discover" at the "Discovery Inn" but the Valley and our weekdn trip was great. We checked in the morning (front desk is small but well organized for how little space there is) but were told the room wasn't ready yet. That's fine, it was expected because we had stopped by at 10am. The lady at the desk said the room was empty though so we could put our luggage in the room if we wanted which we did. We stayed in a king and the room itself actually surprised me (for the better) because I was expecting something smaller. I was a little disappointed there was no coffee making items in the room but oh well, once again, just the basics. We grabbed a map from the office, headed out for the day, and visited a few wineries they had suggested (Sterling was my personal fav). Came back to Napa for dinner and then back to the inn for R&R. If you noticed that we didn't spend time at the hotel, well yeah, we didn't. We literally just used the place to sleep and shower because there's nothing at the place itself to do except look at the huge tower in the parking lot (I never figured out what it was but it looked kinda cool).

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: figgy25
Reviews.Content: We stayed there one night, and I would have been better off sleeping in the care. The room reeked when we got there, and the smell only went away after having the door wide open for a few hours. The bed was rock hard, and the sheets felt dirty. It was a terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for two gals”
Reviews.Author: londonfog496
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my friend visiting me from London and we thought it was ok. Price was on par, room was average with no real highlight or downside, didn't eat breakfast but i remember the coffee smelling good. They need new pillows though that's for sure. My bed had pillows that were flat but hers were good...nothing a visit to the office couldn't fix though. Not much to say other than that...we spent a little time in the room before dinner and after we got back, we both crashed because we were exausted.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsM2003
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there for my birthday and the web site stated there are irons and ironing boards in the rooms which in ours there were not. The walls could do with a clean up and the linen and towels could do with some bleach!! The rooms could do with coffee makers since we did not want to go outside and get coffee but, we did. The pastries were the kind that you would get out of a gas station or a vending machine!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden value @ Napa Discovery Inn!”
Reviews.Author: BiziCali
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an old dive that was rebuilt from the inside out. The ownership added value by upgrading as much as possible in the limited space. The walls, floors and fixtures were pleasant, bed was comfortable and I felt a comfortable distance from the other guests. After grabbing the price online, I'll always have a place to stay in an over-priced Napa at the Discovery Inn.

Reviews.Title: “STINKY Discovery Inn in Napa, California.‎ - ‎ - 2009-10-18”
Reviews.Author: bykimberly
Reviews.Content: NEGATIVE: STINKY Discovery Inn in Napa, California.‎ - ‎ - 2009-10-18 Do not ever stay at the Discovery Inn in Napa, California. The room reeked of dog urine, after the powdery room spray that burned my sinuses wore off. It was so bad I could not sleep. At 4:30 am, I packed up and left. Horrible! Manage denied everything, no refund, blamed it on my dog and was quite scary to talk to at 5AM.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and location to vineyards”
Reviews.Author: luv2trvlQuebec
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect place to stay if you are on a budget and are looking to be close to the action. The hotel has all the amenities of home including a continental breakfast each morning. They also include wireless and if you are lucky a couple of deer in the back of the hotel. Most important is to remember this is an Inn not the Hilton but then again the service is comparable. As for Napa itself, unfortunately due to overbooking at Budget Rent a car in SF we missed half our day of tasting however managed to get in 3 hours of speed tasting including Mondavi tour, Napa Cellars/Menage a trois winery, Domaine Chandon champagne house and Girard tasting room. They were all great and we will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: MightyG
Reviews.Content: Booked this place after finding it online through google. Prices were decent but when I called, I asked about a AAA and got a rate I couldn't pass up. One of my coworkers stayed too. The office is small but on the hot blistering day it was nice to walk into anything that had air conditioning. The room itself was really hot when I walked in but I art my bags down, turned on the aircon and went down the street to get a bite at the place they reccomened for a drink and food (downtown joes). Overall, it got the job done. Nothing truely to rant or rave about... Free wifi is always a plus in my book though!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cozy and great towels!”
Reviews.Author: schilling26
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay, the rooms were very clean. The towels were very nice and thick, and the rooms were cozy and the management was very accommodating and kind. Overall, it was a good stay and I would return if in the area in the future.

Reviews.Title: “This place was horribly disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: xoblondeqt143xo
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I have stayed at many motel 6's & any of those were ten times better than this hole in the wall. We didn't even bother going to talk to the owner because he was so weird & rude. We just handed him the key, paid for a night we didn't stay there, & stayed at the Napa Valley Lodge. I didn't care if I spent $200 more dollars, because I just wanted to get OUT! Do not stay here! I wish I read these reviews previously. Major tourist TRAPPPPP!

Reviews.Title: “great place...and very quite”
Reviews.Author: a7340143
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to the napa valley, found this nice small hotel, very quite location....I usually have trouble sleeping at night....but this motel was really quite at night....Great staff and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price & Location, Good Value for Basics”
Reviews.Author: MJChicago
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling to Napa for business/ leisure for approx 15+ years and have stayed at some of the best hotels in the area. I was traveling alone this time for business so did not need to impress anyone, but wanted comfortable accomdations in a convenient location close to downtown Napa at a "cheap" price- this hotel fit the bill perfectly. It is an older facility, but clean and well maintianed with free wireless access and coffee/bagels in the morn. The owner was helpful with my questions and and courteous in fulfilling my requests. At $95/night including taxes, an unbeatable deal for the accomodations & location- but don't expect to impress a date.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, Great service.”
Reviews.Author: tksmith21
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a convenient location. Just a few minutes from downtown Napa. Very affordable, clean rooms, and accommodating service. I would recommend this for anyone wanting a simple and affordable room in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Beligerent owner & terrible service! Left within 5 minutes!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaCC22
Reviews.Content: Owner was extremely rude and disrespectful. We came to enjoy our time in the Napa area, instead we were driven away within 5 minutes of our arrival. Room quality was deplorable. Rooms were the cheapest in the area because they are disgusting and small. The owner watches your every move from the front desk window, and cowers when confronted about the terrible service and quality of the motel. DONT STAY HERE!! Ended up spending the best $200 just down the street at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and inexpensive.”
Reviews.Author: citoyendumonde
Reviews.Content: Individual cottages with covered parking right at your door. Old style country motel feel. Comfortable bed, Fridge, TV, WI-FI, A/C, heat. Towels are good but not exactly luxuriously soft. Linens are clean and almost new; pillows are good but not great. Location is right off Silverado Trail, at northeast edge of Napa, not very close to main wineries but easy 20min drive to many. Plan on driving to any sights or restaurants, no strolling along the busy roadside, 5min to old town Napa, 25min to Calistoga at north end of valley. Minimal continental breakfast: coffee and bagels good, fruit spare, instant oatmeal packets, milk and OJ but no cold cereal, packaged Danish rolls. If you know where you are going, don't plan on lounging about the room and like saving money while staying close but not right by the sights then try the Napa Discovery Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Due to Cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: rpickar
Reviews.Content: The review of this hotel showed that it was renovated, I expected something decent. When we arrived, a condom wrapper was on the pillow, perched like an after-dinner mint. The room has a strong, rancid smoke odor, even though the door had a "no-smoking" sign. The space heater also gave off a rancid odor. This place could be good for its simplicity and ease -- for example parking your car 4 feet from your front door, and walking just 50-100 feet for breakfast. But it needs total smoke removal and replacement of space heaters to eliminate odor.

Reviews.Title: “don't judge a book by its cover”
Reviews.Author: nisha89
Reviews.Content: This quiet inn is located in a hidden location just a few miles away from downtown Napa. I'll be honest, when I was pulling into the parking lot I was extremely skeptical as to whether or not I'd actually stay. I walked into the office and although it may be small, it had character. Peter was the one that checked me and my husband in. There was a mix up with our reservation because apparently they didn't receive our paper work from Expedia. For all the miscommunication and hassle to call directly to Expedia to figure out what went wrong, Peter offered us a free upgrade to a King size room. The room was a bit on the smaller side but it was clean, cozy, and comfy. I enjoyed the private parking next to my room and the breakfast in the morning. Although there was not a big assortment, it was enough to fill my stomach before wine tasting. One item that I would like to see in the breakfast area is some sort of protein for example eggs or yogurt. Overall I feel bad for judging the place when I first arrived. It may be a two star hotel but it had great accommodations for the price. Breakfast, free wireless, friendly staff. When i return to Napa I will be visiting the Discovery Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place, just don't expect much.”
Reviews.Author: wearytraveler46
Reviews.Content: Napa Discovery Inn is not a bad place to stay. Just don't expect five stars at two star prices. The room was just good; relatively clean and neat. The air conditioner was much too loud, one could almost not sleep. It also did not do a good job of cooling the room. Breakfast was just OK - not much in the way of offerings. We found the location to be convenient to most wineries, which is what we were looking for. Would have liked to be closer to downtown Napa, but that was our fault.

Reviews.Title: “Not so sure about this one”
Reviews.Author: vb_lady
Reviews.Content: We used hotwire to get this hotel in Napa. I wouldn't highly recommend this hotel. The rooms are a little dingy and relatively clean. The towels had some stains and I thought they could have been a bit cleaner. The breakfast "nook" is a joke - some vending food type pastries, coffee and water cooler is all you will find in this tiny corner near the check in desk. The biggest issue I had with the place was the location. It's right on the Silverado Trail, but wasn't super close to anything in downtown Napa despite saying that it is within walking distance to COPIA and other locations. There are no sidewalks on the street to town, which made walking to dinner seem like a bad idea. Honestly, stay in the Travel Lodge. It's closer to everything and should be about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “The price fits the digs”
Reviews.Author: bes166
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at the Discovery Inn. The location is in a somewhat run down section of Napa, but for the adventurous it is possible to walk/bike downtown. We were given a fairly large room that was clean. My major complaints are the lack of pillows (one this pilow per person) and a very loud air conditioner. The price fit the accomodations very well in this case.

Reviews.Title: “The Discovery Inn should be shut down.”
Reviews.Author: easyrider08
Reviews.Content: I wish I had read these reviews before I booked my room. I can't understand how anyone would rate this motel as a good experience. The morning of the day I was to arrive at the Inn, Mina contacted me and said that she did not have a room for my group of 4 adults. I said that I had contacted the Inn a week ago and that my reservation had been confirmed. She replied that since I had not talked to her directly, I did not have a room. She then informed me that I could have 2 rooms for my party of 4. I asked that she charge me the price of one room because the Inn had made an error. She replied that I would be charged for 2 rooms. She then said that she could give me a room with a king size bed and charge me for a cot. She said that 3 of us could sleep in a king size bed. I said that was unacceptable and later she called back with a room with 2 queen size beds. Arriving at the Inn late that evening, I was more than disappointed. Don't be fooled by the photos on the Inn's website. The photos have obviously been enhanced. Rather than a beautiful Ca. sky in the background, picture the industrial section of Napa. Click hybrid on the map on the Inn's site and you will see the true surroundings of the motel. This is not the Napa that is alluded to on their site. I wish I had been more thorough before I had booked my stay. The Inn is an old Ca. motel that has been "spruced up" on the outside. Before checking in, I peeked through a window and saw that the original furnishings were still there. It looked old and run down, definitely not worth the price being charged. Don't be fooled by the website's description of the tasteful remodeling. Having seen the room I promptly called Mina and cancelled my stay. She was extremely rude(as she had been earlier that day) and replied that she would charge me for the room. In retrospect, I should have not asked for her to honor my reservation that morning. Mina did charge me $180 for the room that I did not stay in. After seeing the accommodations and reading the negative reviews on this site, I am glad that I did not stay at the Discovery Inn.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent Napa value and location”
Reviews.Author: teddyk
Reviews.Content: We found the spacious and well appointed room and location to be excellent and appreciated the hospitality and suggestions provided by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience I've ever had”
Reviews.Author: daniella415
Reviews.Content: Hairs on bed, towels, bathroom walls. Stained sheets, horrible service, no amenities. DO NOT STAY HERE. NOT WORTH IT FOR EVEN 20 DOLLARS. If they offered me a free night I would prefer to sleep in my car.

Reviews.Title: “Never Stay Here! Worst Hotel We've ever been to. $196.00 for the worst night!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jackdawson123
Reviews.Content: Horrible, smelly heater/air conditioner in the wall. It was a 1960 version. To loud to use it, so we couldn't sleep with the noise. There was no blanket on the bed so we had to use the extremely heavy quilt, which made us so darn hot we perspired all night. It had holes in it and it was very dirty and it hadn't been washed for months if ever. Glad I didn't have a black light. Bathroom floor was like ICE on bare feet. TV was bad and very small. Cold air came through the door and window. Spiders in the corners. Noisy. To close to the Silverado Highway. You could see outside light where the wall met the floor. They charged us $196.00 for our horrible night. I will call my credit card company for a reversal of my charge if possible. Don't stay here even if it's the only place left in town as was our case.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Great Discovery”
Reviews.Author: NoTV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Discovery Inn one night during a four day bike tour through Napa and Sonoma Valley. I booked this place based on two fairly recent positive reviews on this site. The reviews neglected to mention that the Inn is located about 100 feet off the busy Silverado Trail and it sounds like traffic is running directly through your room. But, the room was clean. I would not stay here again- for a few dollars more, you can have a quieter, more pleasant stay in the town of Napa.

Reviews.Title: “New Management Required”
Reviews.Author: EazyRider
Reviews.Content: So much has already been written about this motel it is hard to think of something new and useful, but here goes! If going to Napa, book your accommodation well in advance so that you do not have to stay in a place like this. Myself and my wife having motorcycled across the States we can confidently say that this was by far the worst accommodation we have had the misfortune to experience. After complaining about the room we were initially allotted the owner agreed to relocate us to a better room, which it was but not worth the $150 pn (more like $40) the excessive use of air freshner was also a little suspicious. The owner seemed overly ambitious for me to write a review of his accommodation and when I read the other reviews I can understand why. I suspect under the current management this motel's days are numbered and not before time.

Reviews.Title: “unless you like to torture yourself...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Discovery Inn is by far the worst place to stay in Napa; I was forced to get a room there because we had failed to make reservations and everywhere else in the town was full(no exaggeration). The owner/manager was exceptionally rude, he actually told us (myself, my husband and my 6-month old son) that we better not have a party or he would call the cops. The room we were in (supposedly the largest available) was tiny, dark, far from inviting, and had this strange musty kind of smell. When my husband walked back up to the office to see about the crib that the owner said he would send to the room, the owner glared and told him that we should have brought our own and that they didn't have one. So my husband very politely asked for a few more blankets & pillows, and told the owner that our son could sleep on the bed with me and he would just sleep on the floor. The owner told him no, that he wouldn't give him any more, because more blankets would mean more people. We finally managed to get one of the "housekeepers" (I use the term very loosely) to give us a pillow and a blanket that looked like they belonged to a homeless shelter. Then we made the mistake of moving a nightstand so that my husband could sleep right along the edge of the bed that my son would be on, for extra safety, and to our extreme horror we found a half-empty bag of what looked like crystal meth, and some hypodermic needles. Needless to say, we left right then and there without even inquiring about getting our money back, and drove for 45 minutes to Solano County to find somewhere clean and decent to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am 56 years old and have traveled extensively. Believe me when I say this was the WORST room I have ever stayed in. Upon entering the room it smelled like....... I’m not sure but it wasn't good. There was a half consumed paper cup of coffee someone had left on the bathroom windowsill, long black hairs stuck on the bath wall and grout that looked mostly black but was originally white silicone. It appeared that the cleaning person regularly swept everything under the beds (popcorn, etc). The sheets looked clean and it was late so I just folded down the disgusting bedspread, took a sleeping pill, curled up in the fetal position and went to sleep. Couldn’t quite bring myself to take a morning shower under the conditions so packed the car and left for home. I suggest you pay an extra $25.00 bucks and stay somewhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here unless”
Reviews.Author: cecilskong
Reviews.Content: you want to pay over $100 to stay in a dark, dank, dirty room with a VERY noisy air conditioner/heater combo. I dropped an earring near the bed and was disgusted to see the dust bunnies and dead spiders underneath the bed. The manager asked an extra $10 for our well travelled dachshund to stay there, and then ran to check the room before we left, as if it could get any worse. To date our worst ever motel stay.
